locutie.beschrijving: The sermon explores the theme of divine judgment, the inadequacy of human justice (using the Cheshire trial), and the eschatological promise of God's refining fire.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. Connects the canonical placement of Malachi to the Advent season and the Synoptic Apocalypse.

illocutie.beschrijving: The preacher moves from asserting the reality of judgment to promising God's transformative action.
voorbeelden: I want to focus somewhere else.
The promise of the divine judgment is that evil and death will be undone.
May he establish your hearts blameless.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: Humility, abandonment of self-righteousness, and comfort in God's refining power.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Explicitly mentioned as the power by which God prepares the believer.

voorbeelden: Malachi is the last book of the Christian Old Testament.
Human beings do not have the power to undo evil.
Remember this the next time you hear Handel’s Messiah.
Ponder the possibility that we might be on the wrong side.
Ah, but we don’t believe that, do we?
The promise of the divine judgment is that evil and death will be undone.
Advent promises that God will come.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Strong theological grounding, though often phrased as 'The promise is...' (Assertive about a Commissive) rather than 'I promise you in God's name'.

voorbeelden: May he establish your hearts blameless in holiness.
declaratieven.autoriteit: The preacher uses the liturgical 'May he...' (Optative/Declarative) to mediate the blessing.

indicatoren: Extensive use of literary and cultural examples (Auden, Camus, Cheshire trial).
Long sections describing the 'problem' of modern enlightenment.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is well-informed and intellectually engaged but remains an observer of the 'judgment' theme for a large portion of the text.

performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The 'event' of being refined by God is described as a future or general promise rather than happening *now* through the word.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: Theological and robust, though slightly distanced by third-person phrasing.
voorbeelden: The Lord is at work establishing their hearts.
All the evil within our own hearts... will be undone.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Inclusive 'we' to identify with the congregation's skepticism and sin.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address used to place the hearer at the judgment seat.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used effectively in the final blessing.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Dominant mode; discussing 'modern Christians', 'the jurors', 'the Bible'.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a lecture-like atmosphere in the first half.

verleden_tijd.gebruik: Biblical history and the Connecticut trial.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: Theological truths about God and judgment.

actueel_present.gebruik: The liturgical 'now' of Advent and the closing blessing.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Moves from the reality of judgment (Assertive) to the work of God (Commissive) to the final blessing (Declarative).
voorbeelden: God will judge (Assertive) -> The Lord is at work in them (Commissive) -> May he establish your hearts (Declarative).

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: Because the Lord is at work... [therefore] ponder the possibility.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: Despite the constative surplus in the beginning, the sermon successfully pivots to a performative conclusion where the Word does what it says: it promises and blesses.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The Lord is at work establishing their hearts.
sterke_punten.effect: Shifts the burden from human effort to divine action.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The lengthy description of the Cheshire trial.
zwakke_punten.probleem: Risk of the 'event' being the story rather than the Word.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The sermon becomes an event when it stops talking about judgment and starts applying the refining fire as a promise.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The use of the Malachi 'refining' imagery functions as a verbal sacrament.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: God is portrayed as the active agent who speaks through the prophet and the Spirit.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: The preacher acts as a herald of the 'Second Coming'.
tekstueel_bewijs: The gospel calls us to abandon our pretensions.

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Yes, as the power of God working in the believer.
tekstueel_bewijs: working in us by the power of the Holy Spirit.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: The sermon treats the 'Promise' as the means by which the hearer is prepared for judgment.
sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: The 'Bottom of the Night' imagery serves an epiphanic function.
tekstueel_bewijs: The promise... is that evil and death will be undone.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Heavy on 'is' and 'says' (Assertive); needs more 'I announce' or 'God gives' (Declarative).

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The promise of the divine judgment is that evil and death will be undone.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: In this judgment, God promises you today: your evil and your death are being undone.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from a description of a promise to the act of promising.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is often 'about' the text.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Use more direct address in the second person.
voorbeeldzinnen: Christ is refining you like gold even now.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A deeply theological sermon that avoids the trap of moralism by grounding the 'event' in God's refining action.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SAT identifies the 'Declarative' power of the Word to change the hearer's status before God, which SvT's psychological model cannot capture.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: The focus is not on the persuasiveness of the Cheshire trial story, but on the illocutionary force of the Malachi promise.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's power peaks when the preacher stops describing the 'Last Things' and starts 'establishing hearts' through the spoken blessing.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: The Lord is at work in them.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a model of how to handle 'hard' topics (judgment) without falling into legalism, by using the performative power of the Gospel promise.
